snippet: Low interest rates mean retirees must save more money to produce the same income or invest in assets with higher yields but possibly higher risk.
abstract: Near record low interest rates mean retirees must save more money to produce the same income or invest in assets with higher yields but possibly higher risk; financial advisers say investors should acquire mix of assets that can produce greater total return--income plus capital growth--from which to finance retirement needs.
lead_paragraph: Low interest rates mean retirees must save more money to produce the same income or invest in assets with higher yields but possibly higher risk.

headline.seo: Finding the Right Mix of Assets for Retirement Savings
headline.main: Choice for Tight Times: Save More or More Risk
headline.print_headline: Choice for Tight Times: Save More or Take On More Risk
